conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The two cars are side by side at \( t = 30 \) seconds.
The v-t graphs for Cars A and B are provided.
The v-t graph shows Car A's velocity increasing linearly from 0 to 40 m/s between \( t = 0 \) and \( t = 10 \) seconds, then remaining constant at 40 m/s until \( t = 30 \) seconds.
The v-t graph shows Car B's velocity increasing linearly from 0 to 40 m/s between \( t = 0 \) and \( t = 20 \) seconds, then continuing to increase linearly until \( t = 30 \) seconds.
The v-t graph indicates that the two cars are side by side at \( t = 30 \) seconds.
The v-t graph shows that Car A's velocity is 40 m/s at \( t = 10 \) seconds.
The v-t graph shows that Car B's velocity is 20 m/s at \( t = 10 \) seconds.
Car A is ahead of Car B at \( t = 10 \) seconds because its distance traveled is greater than Car B's distance traveled.
